page.title: 02THE VILLAGE CHURCH _ HISTORY
page.content: {Belbroughton}village church now stands on a site originally occupied by a{Saxon}church at the time of the { {Domesday Book.}In{Norman}times the church was rebuilt, some parts of which still remain and rebuilding has taken place from the late thirteenth century. The church now has an old nave and chancel built in the fourteenth century and a more modern nave and chancel built in 1894. In early {medieval}times, when there was no meeting place for the people of the village, the nave was used as a meeting place and market. Feasts were celebrated there and there would have been plenty of room because there were no seats only a stone bench around the walls.
